pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This PR is shorter than it seems: 43 lines are comments. I don't know any references for this stuff, I'm proving it myself, so I figured I may as well document the proofs as I find them.

|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.ModuleTopology.eq_coinduced_of_surjective`
`+ continuousNeg`
`+ isQuotientMap_of_surjective`
`+ topologicalAddGroup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12447985598/job/34752078287)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12447985598/job/34752078246)

But it isn't Lean-straightforward to deduce that from this statement, is it? Because you can only apply this statement if you already have an `IsModuleTopology R B`.
Do you think you can factor out this pushforward claim into a prerequisite lemma?

I've factored it out into a corollary. In fact you've spotted a glitch in the PR (now fixed): in an earlier version of this work I was claiming as the main (only) result that the pushforward of the module topology was the module topology, and then after discussions with Yury he convinced me that it was much cleaner to state that a surjection was a quotient map, so I restated the result to the thing you now see, but forgot to change the name. I've now changed the name of the main lemma to  `IsModuleTopology.isQuotientMap_of_surjective` (which is what I prove) and have added the corollary `ModuleTopology.eq_coinduced_of_surjective` which says what it's supposed to say. In applications I expect `IsModuleTopology` to be more widely used than `moduleTopology` so I am trying to frame everything in this language.

Great! Finally, do you want to mention this result under "Main theorems"?

bors d+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Algebra/Module/ModuleTopology): continuous linear surjections are quotient maps
